CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 9, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "Citizens Cleaned But City Didn't - Although many times when the city trucks clean up 'hokey' piles, the citizenry comes right back the [illegible] ...right to bring more trash, in this instance the case was reversed, recently Hill District citizens went to much trouble to clean up this [ill.] ...of ground atop the Chauncey Street steps, as is shown in the bottom photos. Rubbish was dumped into deep ravines, as can be seen by the pictures and plot, long an eyesore, was planted with victory gardens. The city failed, however, to clean up the 'hokey' pile at Chauncey and Halket Streets, adjacent to the area. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Hillside with "hokey pile" of trash and debris near Chauncey Street, Hill District
